pullrequest.title: patches for getting atlas to walk in simbody

content.raw:
Issue #539 has already been resolved, though there is a separate issue that keeps this functionality from working in bullet. The getAabb function for plane shapes returns large values for every dimension, even if the plane normal is aligned with coordinate axes (see [upstream issue](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/issues/211)). I'm planning a workaround, but it will require a new version of gazebo.

I'll file a gazebo ticket for the plane shape bounding box and rephrase this error message accordingly.
content.html:
Issue #539 has already been resolved, though there is a separate issue that keeps this functionality from working in bullet. The getAabb function for plane shapes returns large values for every dimension, even if the plane normal is aligned with coordinate axes (see upstream issue). I'm planning a workaround, but it will require a new version of gazebo.

I'll file a gazebo ticket for the plane shape bounding box and rephrase this error message accordingly.

content.raw:
I'm getting an error message during the launch:

```
[ INFO] [1409190049.026853789, 0.023000000]: waitForService: Service [/gazebo/set_physics_properties] is now available.
[ERROR] [1409190049.057284264, 0.053000000]: Exception thrown while processing service call: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[ERROR] [1409190049.057427053, 0.053000000]: Service call failed: service [/gazebo/get_physics_properties] responded with an error: boost::bad_any_cast: failed conversion using boost::any_cast
[ INFO] [1409190049.071349144, 0.067000000]: Physics dynamic reconfigure ready.
```
Anybody see it too?

pullrequest.title: patches for getting atlas to walk in simbody

content.raw:
I'm unable to get the controller from the 2.10.2 version to work. I just create a catkin workspace with this branch and replace the `install/lib/AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2/libAtlasSimInterface.so`. What am I doing wrong? All the time the robot just falls down.

**Update**: Carlos explained me how to copy the whole lib64/ directory from the official controller.
content.html:
I'm unable to get the controller from the 2.10.2 version to work. I just create a catkin workspace with this branch and replace the install/lib/AtlasSimInterface_2.10.2/libAtlasSimInterface.so. What am I doing wrong? All the time the robot just falls down.

Update: Carlos explained me how to copy the whole lib64/ directory from the official controller.

content.raw:
When I just start gazebo + simbody and insert the Atlas model, it just segfault before ending of insert the robot. No related to this PR at all, but I can not test this. Any idea?

```
[66956.232959] gzserver[1838]: segfault at 118 ip 00002b7bc3baf764 sp 00002b7bed404930 error 4 in libSimTKsimbody.so.3.4[2b7bc390d000+49d000]
[66956.534109] gzclient[1796]: segfault at b0 ip 00002b584baa5122 sp 00007fffe4e47630 error 4 in libgazebo_rendering.so.4.0.0[2b584b99a000+187000]
```

pullrequest.title: patches for getting atlas to walk in simbody

content.raw:
Ok, now that pull request #451 is merged, this is working again! I can make atlas walk with bullet and simbody, though I haven't tested with dart recently because I'm using the debs (though I did some testing with dart a couple weeks ago).

I am seeing the following console message, which we should disable in gazebo (I will make a pull request).
~~~
[Err] [SimbodyLink.cc:531] Not implemented.
~~~

Update: [gazebo pull request 1185](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1185/remove-simbodylink-addtorque-console/diff)
content.html:
Ok, now that pull request #451 is merged, this is working again! I can make atlas walk with bullet and simbody, though I haven't tested with dart recently because I'm using the debs (though I did some testing with dart a couple weeks ago).

I am seeing the following console message, which we should disable in gazebo (I will make a pull request).

[Err] [SimbodyLink.cc:531] Not implemented.

Update: gazebo pull request 1185

pullrequest.title: patches for getting atlas to walk in simbody

content.raw:
I was able to use the keyboard teleop launching atlas with simbody and ode without any problem. great!

atlas_v3 is failing with both, but I believe that is out of the scope of this PR.
